titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stephen G. Bickford Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 08:43

did.unittitle: Stephen G. Bickford papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The Stephen G. Bickford papers consist of correspondence, photographs, newspaper clippings, primarily concerning USAF GLOBE, an organization founded by Bickford to advocate for gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender non discrimination for civilians in the Air Force.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stephen G. Bickford Papers (MS 1977). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three sections: Air Force Gay and Lesbian Or Bisexual Employees (GLOBE) files, Personal files, and Topical files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Stephen Gard Bickford was born in Lewiston, Maine, on December 7, 1954, and was educated at the University of Connecticut and the University of Idaho where he studied mathematics and architecture respectively. In 1980, Mr. Bickford accepted a position with the United States Air Force at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base near Dayton, Ohio, where he worked in the design and construction of Air Force facilities, building additions and renovations. In 1993, following President Bill Clinton's pledge to support the rights of gay federal workers, Bickford "came out" and began to advocate for the rights of gay Air Force civilian employees. On March 13, 1997, Bickford established USAF GLOBE (Gay and Lesbian or Bisexual Employees), a nationwide organization to help gay or lesbian civilian employees of the U.S. Air Force. The mission of USAF GLOBE was to educate gay and lesbian employees on their rights against non-job related conduct discrimination and federal guidelines related to sexual orientation.
Mr. Bickford served as the president of USAF GLOBE from 1997 to 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Stephen G. Bickford papers consist of correspondence, photographs, and newspaper clippings, primarily concerning USAF GLOBE, an organization founded by Bickford to advocate for gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender non-discrimination for civilians in the Air Force.

scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Bickford in an operatic performance and at a party.
